element.name: OBS Business Compliance Management
element.documentation: Ability to establish and monitor conformance with external and internal compliance requirements, conducting remediation efforts, executing periodic internal audits, and interfacing with external auditors.

property.value: Ability to establish and monitor conformance with external and internal compliance requirements, conducting remediation efforts, executing periodic internal audits, and interfacing with external auditors.

element.name: External developments monitoring
element.documentation: Ability to keep abreast of all relevant market and other external developments to be able to assist in the interpretation of the financial information. Objective Enable relevant decision support to management.

property.value: Ability to keep abreast of all relevant market and other external developments to be able to assist in the interpretation of the financial information. Objective Enable relevant decision support to management.

element.name: Finance Management
element.documentation: The ability to provide insightful and timely business intelligence, enabling ING?s management to make superior financial decisions and achieve a sustainable competitive advantage in the market through: Empowering ING?s managers and stakeholders to plan, forecast, control, and continuously optimize financial performance, by providing timely, accurate and relevant business intelligence and decision support;` Providing financial accounting and regulatory reporting in full compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements, achieving best-in-class Finance Total cost of ownership by efficiently and flawlessly managing operational activities; Enforcing and coordinating rigorous financial controls and bank-wide governance and reporting to establish cost transparency, proactively manage financial performance against clear targets, and instill a cost-conscious culture across the organisation; Supporting ING?s business and financial strategy - incl. scenario analysis and investment reviews - to unlock value-add opportunities and optimize financial returns; Maintaining a continuous and accurate oversight also on the correct implementation of policies, effecting financial reporting process.

property.value: The ability to provide insightful and timely business intelligence, enabling ING?s management to make superior financial decisions and achieve a sustainable competitive advantage in the market through: Empowering ING?s managers and stakeholders to plan, forecast, control, and continuously optimize financial performance, by providing timely, accurate and relevant business intelligence and decision support;` Providing financial accounting and regulatory reporting in full compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements, achieving best-in-class Finance Total cost of ownership by efficiently and flawlessly managing operational activities; Enforcing and coordinating rigorous financial controls and bank-wide governance and reporting to establish cost transparency, proactively manage financial performance against clear targets, and instill a cost-conscious culture across the organisation; Supporting ING?s business and financial strategy - incl. scenario analysis and investment reviews - to unlock value-add opportunities and optimize financial returns; Maintaining a continuous and accurate oversight also on the correct implementation of policies, effecting financial reporting process.

element.name: Obligation Management
element.documentation: Ability to maintain a view of obligations of the ING enterprise to comply with laws and regulations.

property.value: Ability to maintain a view of obligations of the ING enterprise to comply with laws and regulations.

element.name: Risks to capital management
element.documentation: Ability to manage the uncertainties related to capital planning and risks-to-capital through different concepts and elements such as the Management buffer, alternative planning scenarios or contingency capital planning. Objective To ensure that the business strategy is successfully executed while staying in line with internal and external capital adequacy considerations and risk appetite limits.

property.value: Ability to manage the uncertainties related to capital planning and risks-to-capital through different concepts and elements such as the Management buffer, alternative planning scenarios or contingency capital planning. Objective To ensure that the business strategy is successfully executed while staying in line with internal and external capital adequacy considerations and risk appetite limits.

element.name: Data Quality Management
element.documentation: Ability to ensure the quality of data along 7 axis (DAMA and BCBS239): Timeliness, Completeness, Validity, Accuracy, Uniqueness, Consistency, Adaptability

property.value: Ability to ensure the quality of data along 7 axis (DAMA and BCBS239): Timeliness, Completeness, Validity, Accuracy, Uniqueness, Consistency, Adaptability

element.name: Audit
element.documentation: Ability to provide independent assurance that an organisation's risk management, governance and internal control processes are operating effectively.

property.value: Ability to provide independent assurance that an organisation's risk management, governance and internal control processes are operating effectively.

element.name: Reporting channel management
element.documentation: Ability to align with the reporting stakeholder on the methodology, content, timing and technical aspects of the reporting channel. Objective To deliver the right insights and information in a consistent, timely and agreed way.

property.value: Ability to align with the reporting stakeholder on the methodology, content, timing and technical aspects of the reporting channel. Objective To deliver the right insights and information in a consistent, timely and agreed way.

element.name: Policy Definition & Boundary Management
element.documentation: Ability to establish, declare, and identify a policy and shape its main definitions (risks, obligations, control objectives) that shape the boundaries and that address the obligations of the ING enterprise.

property.value: Ability to establish, declare, and identify a policy and shape its main definitions (risks, obligations, control objectives) that shape the boundaries and that address the obligations of the ING enterprise.

element.name: Internal Compliance Monitoring
element.documentation: Ability to monitor systems and processes to ensure they comply with security standards, as well as corporate policies and requirements

property.value: Ability to monitor systems and processes to ensure they comply with security standards, as well as corporate policies and requirements

element.name: Tax Management
element.documentation: Ability to assist management in meeting tax obligations imposed by laws and regulations, to manage risks related to these obligations and optimizing after tax result, to exert oversight and control on above activities and to ensure that the financial consequences of ING?s tax obligations are adequately reflected in ING?s financial statements.

property.value: Ability to assist management in meeting tax obligations imposed by laws and regulations, to manage risks related to these obligations and optimizing after tax result, to exert oversight and control on above activities and to ensure that the financial consequences of ING?s tax obligations are adequately reflected in ING?s financial statements.

element.name: Financial Benchmarking
element.documentation: Ability to identify, understand, compare and adapt the successful (financial) business practices and financial processes used by other companies (or even other (Finance) departments within the same company) to increase your own business success. Objective Compare the Bank?s performance, practices and processes to make improvements and increase success.

property.value: Ability to identify, understand, compare and adapt the successful (financial) business practices and financial processes used by other companies (or even other (Finance) departments within the same company) to increase your own business success. Objective Compare the Bank?s performance, practices and processes to make improvements and increase success.

element.name: Change Execution
element.documentation: Ability to mobilize a series of tools and techniques to implement the benefits of a project or a program, through the explicit management of scope, resources, risk, budget, planning, quality of delivery and communication

property.value: Ability to mobilize a series of tools and techniques to implement the benefits of a project or a program, through the explicit management of scope, resources, risk, budget, planning, quality of delivery and communication

element.name: SoR data to Financial reporting data model transposing
element.documentation: Ability to structure and store the Source data (Business Objects), related Accounting data and Financials in such a manner that it can be enriched and reported according the reporting requirements. Objective To provide the data in such a structure that it facilitates the manner in which the data is to be enriched, reconciled, and reported. Examples: - creation of a reconciliation data set - creation of a data set for a Liquidity or Asset Encumbrance calculation - Data mart creation, in a - transactional data model to facilitate aggregations / calculations for different reports. or - Star Schema to facilitate BI reporting

property.value: Ability to structure and store the Source data (Business Objects), related Accounting data and Financials in such a manner that it can be enriched and reported according the reporting requirements. Objective To provide the data in such a structure that it facilitates the manner in which the data is to be enriched, reconciled, and reported. Examples: - creation of a reconciliation data set - creation of a data set for a Liquidity or Asset Encumbrance calculation - Data mart creation, in a - transactional data model to facilitate aggregations / calculations for different reports. or - Star Schema to facilitate BI reporting

element.name: Consolidation Accounting
element.documentation: Ability to aggregate and eliminate figures into a consolidated financial statement according to consolidation standards and Finance policies and guidelines.

property.value: Ability to aggregate and eliminate figures into a consolidated financial statement according to consolidation standards and Finance policies and guidelines.

element.name: Accounting
element.documentation: Ability to maintain, by means of a controlled process, a permanent summary of classified financial positions (?bookkeeping of balances?) and the determination of the periodic financial results that capture the state of the enterprise at particular moments in time ( ?closing of the books?) based on financial events, accounting rules in accordance with different national and international accounting standards, and analytical review of financial data. This results in ?one time right? data necessary for external and internal purposes. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate and timely) recording and processing of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements. Definition financial event A business event with financial impact containing all the necessary information to fulfill all accounting needs'.

property.value: Ability to maintain, by means of a controlled process, a permanent summary of classified financial positions (?bookkeeping of balances?) and the determination of the periodic financial results that capture the state of the enterprise at particular moments in time ( ?closing of the books?) based on financial events, accounting rules in accordance with different national and international accounting standards, and analytical review of financial data. This results in ?one time right? data necessary for external and internal purposes. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate and timely) recording and processing of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements. Definition financial event A business event with financial impact containing all the necessary information to fulfill all accounting needs'.

element.name: Acquisitions and divestments advice and support
element.documentation: Ability to support the sourcing, evaluation and execution of acquisitions, divestments, joint ventures and partnerships / strategic alliances for ING. Objective To support management in acquiring or divesting decisions.

property.value: Ability to support the sourcing, evaluation and execution of acquisitions, divestments, joint ventures and partnerships / strategic alliances for ING. Objective To support management in acquiring or divesting decisions.

element.name: Data Requirements and Demand Management
element.documentation: Ability to obtain data requirements from stakeholders and translate that into a data demand towards data owners, data users and distributors.

property.value: Ability to obtain data requirements from stakeholders and translate that into a data demand towards data owners, data users and distributors.

element.name: Business Event Translation
element.documentation: Ability to determine which Business Events have a financial impact, enrich these business events with additional characteristics in order to be able to translate these financial events into accounting events, resulting in a journal to be processed by Detailed Accounting or Consolidation Accounting. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate, and timely recording of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements.

property.value: Ability to determine which Business Events have a financial impact, enrich these business events with additional characteristics in order to be able to translate these financial events into accounting events, resulting in a journal to be processed by Detailed Accounting or Consolidation Accounting. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate, and timely recording of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements.

element.name: Strategy & Execution
element.documentation: Ability to lead the investigation related to the market requirements, the customer demands, the strategy formulation as well as the key activities to allocate resources, control and manage the implementation required to materialize the benefits

property.value: Ability to lead the investigation related to the market requirements, the customer demands, the strategy formulation as well as the key activities to allocate resources, control and manage the implementation required to materialize the benefits

element.name: Capital planning
element.documentation: Ability to plan how ING will finance the expected capital constraints taking into consideration growth projections, capital and risk evolution, macro and market conditions, both under the normative and economic perspective. It also covers specific deep dives into several topics such as for capital allocation. Objective To inform and advise the management on the capital and funding development and need of ING Group and Bank, under base case and adverse scenarios.

property.value: Ability to plan how ING will finance the expected capital constraints taking into consideration growth projections, capital and risk evolution, macro and market conditions, both under the normative and economic perspective. It also covers specific deep dives into several topics such as for capital allocation. Objective To inform and advise the management on the capital and funding development and need of ING Group and Bank, under base case and adverse scenarios.

element.name: Architecture Support for Change Initiatives & Portfolio Management
Distribution
element.documentation: Ability to distribute data and insights to internal and external requestors conform their requirements. Objective To deliver the applicable and reported insights to internal and external stakeholders conform their requirements. Examples Mail, Reporting Portal

property.value: Ability to distribute data and insights to internal and external requestors conform their requirements. Objective To deliver the applicable and reported insights to internal and external stakeholders conform their requirements. Examples Mail, Reporting Portal

element.name: Data Management
element.documentation: Ability to govern all the data created, modified, deleted, archived, stored and used at ING in terms of definition, ethics, quality, and fit for consumption

property.value: Ability to govern all the data created, modified, deleted, archived, stored and used at ING in terms of definition, ethics, quality, and fit for consumption

element.name: Finance statutory reporting
element.documentation: Ability to produce, review financial statutory reports (reporting of the financial position and financial performance of ING through financial statements issued to external users on a periodic basis. This also includes handling inquiries from regulators. Objective To inform external stakeholders involved, compliant with statutory requirements, about the financial position and performance of ING or elements thereof.

property.value: Ability to produce, review financial statutory reports (reporting of the financial position and financial performance of ING through financial statements issued to external users on a periodic basis. This also includes handling inquiries from regulators. Objective To inform external stakeholders involved, compliant with statutory requirements, about the financial position and performance of ING or elements thereof.

element.name: Back reporting
element.documentation: Ability to provide transparency and substantiates the Service Center's Control Statement by means of reporting over and providing insight into the outcome of the executed key controls and the reporting results (including underlying data) to local Finance. Objective To facilitate local Finance Management to exercise its responsibility in terms of accountability and sign-off on the Letter of Representation (LoR).

property.value: Ability to provide transparency and substantiates the Service Center's Control Statement by means of reporting over and providing insight into the outcome of the executed key controls and the reporting results (including underlying data) to local Finance. Objective To facilitate local Finance Management to exercise its responsibility in terms of accountability and sign-off on the Letter of Representation (LoR).

element.name: Authoritative reporting
element.documentation: Ability to manage ING Business (first line of defense) compliance as a shared responsibility, on top of the distinct accountabilities and capabilities of ING Business, Operations, Finance & Risk, to enable ING Business to comply with their authoritative reporting requirements in close collaboration with Operations, Finance and Risk. As such, it should: establish oversight, a consolidated single view across all Authoritative reporting requirements, content-wise, portfolio-wise and implementation roadmap-wise. establish a set of well-considered priorities and provide insight to all different stakeholders on a.o.: how various initiatives interrelate and overlap to create awareness of the bank-wide impact of the requirements and its complexity act as ?one voice? towards: Authorities to influence their requirement setting re. priorities, standardisation and operationalization (a.o. to avoid local gold-plating / deviations from international standards) ING Business to provide a timely oversight and insight in the change calendar related to authoritative reporting

property.value: Ability to manage ING Business (first line of defense) compliance as a shared responsibility, on top of the distinct accountabilities and capabilities of ING Business, Operations, Finance & Risk, to enable ING Business to comply with their authoritative reporting requirements in close collaboration with Operations, Finance and Risk. As such, it should: establish oversight, a consolidated single view across all Authoritative reporting requirements, content-wise, portfolio-wise and implementation roadmap-wise. establish a set of well-considered priorities and provide insight to all different stakeholders on a.o.: how various initiatives interrelate and overlap to create awareness of the bank-wide impact of the requirements and its complexity act as ?one voice? towards: Authorities to influence their requirement setting re. priorities, standardisation and operationalization (a.o. to avoid local gold-plating / deviations from international standards) ING Business to provide a timely oversight and insight in the change calendar related to authoritative reporting

element.name: Enterprise Architecture
element.documentation: Ability to identify impacts of strategic decisions and design the business models, operating models, high level IT architectures and recommends the investments, to implement the strategy

property.value: Ability to identify impacts of strategic decisions and design the business models, operating models, high level IT architectures and recommends the investments, to implement the strategy

element.name: Finance regulatory reporting
element.documentation: Ability to produce, review and submit regulatory reports (reporting to the regulators, including supervisory reporting as part of the regulators' prudential supervision). This also includes handling inquiries from regulators. Objective To inform the regulatory bodies, compliant with their requirements, about the financial position and performance of ING or elements thereof.

property.value: Ability to produce, review and submit regulatory reports (reporting to the regulators, including supervisory reporting as part of the regulators' prudential supervision). This also includes handling inquiries from regulators. Objective To inform the regulatory bodies, compliant with their requirements, about the financial position and performance of ING or elements thereof.

element.name: Signoff on to-be reported finance insights
element.documentation: Ability to sign off and take responsibility on reported finance information (or underlying data). Objective To enable the stakeholder responsible for the reported information to take responsibility on the correctness and completeness of the underlying data.

property.value: Ability to sign off and take responsibility on reported finance information (or underlying data). Objective To enable the stakeholder responsible for the reported information to take responsibility on the correctness and completeness of the underlying data.

element.name: Strategy Planning
element.documentation: Ability to clearly shape and formulate the strategy, articulate the benefits over time and the high level roadmap of development of ING

property.value: Ability to clearly shape and formulate the strategy, articulate the benefits over time and the high level roadmap of development of ING

element.name: Representation and Signoff
element.documentation: The ability to disclose insights and take responsibility for the disclosed underlying data.

property.value: The ability to disclose insights and take responsibility for the disclosed underlying data.

element.name: Reference & Master Data Management
element.documentation: Ability to maintain, publish and distribute Value Ranges, Master Data (on Organisation, Products and Customers), Market Data and other static data elements.

property.value: Ability to maintain, publish and distribute Value Ranges, Master Data (on Organisation, Products and Customers), Market Data and other static data elements.

element.name: Finance periodical Internal reporting
element.documentation: Ability to produce, review and submit periodical reports / data based on the requirements from the business (local and group determined requirements). Objective To provide Business management insight about the financial position and performance of the Bank or elements thereof, in order to support business decisions.

property.value: Ability to produce, review and submit periodical reports / data based on the requirements from the business (local and group determined requirements). Objective To provide Business management insight about the financial position and performance of the Bank or elements thereof, in order to support business decisions.

element.name: Insight disclosure
element.documentation: The ability to disclose insights in a static (document / templates) or dynamic way (dashboards/video). Objective Disclose the required insight in the requested format. Examples The preparation of the reports for submission/ filing to external stakeholders. It includes integrating all components of the internal and external reports such as Management Summary in the Annual report and the press release info

property.value: The ability to disclose insights in a static (document / templates) or dynamic way (dashboards/video). Objective Disclose the required insight in the requested format. Examples The preparation of the reports for submission/ filing to external stakeholders. It includes integrating all components of the internal and external reports such as Management Summary in the Annual report and the press release info

element.name: Finance reporting to other external stakeholders
element.documentation: Ability to produce, review and submit all reports to External Stakeholders, excluding supervisory and regulatory reports. This also includes handling enquiries from external stakeholders. Objective To inform external stakeholders about the financial position and performance of ING or elements thereof.

property.value: Ability to produce, review and submit all reports to External Stakeholders, excluding supervisory and regulatory reports. This also includes handling enquiries from external stakeholders. Objective To inform external stakeholders about the financial position and performance of ING or elements thereof.

element.name: Insight integration
element.documentation: Ability to integrate facts, prepared by other capabilities to construct meaningful information, to the requirements of the requestors to enable decision making. Objective To transform and combine data that is created in various parts of the organisation into insights that suit the requirements of the stakeholders used so they can take decisions Examples Combining party information with RWA Customer Profitability Cost Income Ratio Consolidation from entities to group Loan to deposit ratio Stakeholder list Regulator, authorities, asset owners of tools and applications and other stakeholders that use the data.

property.value: Ability to integrate facts, prepared by other capabilities to construct meaningful information, to the requirements of the requestors to enable decision making. Objective To transform and combine data that is created in various parts of the organisation into insights that suit the requirements of the stakeholders used so they can take decisions Examples Combining party information with RWA Customer Profitability Cost Income Ratio Consolidation from entities to group Loan to deposit ratio Stakeholder list Regulator, authorities, asset owners of tools and applications and other stakeholders that use the data.

element.name: Financial computations
element.documentation: Ability to calculate all internal and external required financials, both backward and forward looking, to enable Finance reporting to internal and external stakeholders. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate and timely) calculation and recording financial data which comply with internal and external requirements. Example: - LCR HQLA - Asset Encumbrance

property.value: Ability to calculate all internal and external required financials, both backward and forward looking, to enable Finance reporting to internal and external stakeholders. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate and timely) calculation and recording financial data which comply with internal and external requirements. Example: - LCR HQLA - Asset Encumbrance

element.name: Capitalisation management
element.documentation: Ability to ensure all entities are sufficient and adequate capitalised to support business growth under the current and future market conditions and regulatory framework. capitalised based on the same methodology and to align with international tax standards by applying an agreed on a group-wide capital allocation framework ensuring a coherent capitalization throughout the group . Objective GT BS&CM ensures the entities are sufficiently capitalized from a regulatory, economic and tax perspective in order to support the intended business development under the current and future market conditions. At the same time, capitalization needs to be allocated in a consistent way throughout the group entities (subsidiaries and branches) based on ING?s capital allocation approach striving for a level playing field across the ING Group when it concerns allocation of capital and challenges the current capital allocation where needed.

property.value: Ability to ensure all entities are sufficient and adequate capitalised to support business growth under the current and future market conditions and regulatory framework. capitalised based on the same methodology and to align with international tax standards by applying an agreed on a group-wide capital allocation framework ensuring a coherent capitalization throughout the group . Objective GT BS&CM ensures the entities are sufficiently capitalized from a regulatory, economic and tax perspective in order to support the intended business development under the current and future market conditions. At the same time, capitalization needs to be allocated in a consistent way throughout the group entities (subsidiaries and branches) based on ING?s capital allocation approach striving for a level playing field across the ING Group when it concerns allocation of capital and challenges the current capital allocation where needed.

element.name: Finance reporting to internal stakeholders
element.documentation: Ability to produce, explain, review and submit reports / data to internal stakeholders with respect to business results, trends and financial issues. This also includes handling inquiries from internal stakeholders. Objective To provide Business management insight about the financial position and performance of the Bank or elements thereof, in order to support business decisions.

property.value: Ability to produce, explain, review and submit reports / data to internal stakeholders with respect to business results, trends and financial issues. This also includes handling inquiries from internal stakeholders. Objective To provide Business management insight about the financial position and performance of the Bank or elements thereof, in order to support business decisions.

element.name: Reporting stakeholder management
element.documentation: Ability to connect to and agree with stakeholders on requirements, methodology, content, timing and technical aspects of the reporting channel. Objective To make sure all requirements are clear and agreed upon with regards to the distribution of the required data and insights. Examples Meetings, Requirement Management sheets Stakeholderlist

property.value: Ability to connect to and agree with stakeholders on requirements, methodology, content, timing and technical aspects of the reporting channel. Objective To make sure all requirements are clear and agreed upon with regards to the distribution of the required data and insights. Examples Meetings, Requirement Management sheets Stakeholderlist

element.name: Finance ad hoc internal reporting
element.documentation: Ability to produce, review and submit ad hoc reports / data based on ad hoc requirements / requests from the Business (local and group determined requirements). This also includes handling enquiries from internal stakeholders.

property.value: Ability to produce, review and submit ad hoc reports / data based on ad hoc requirements / requests from the Business (local and group determined requirements). This also includes handling enquiries from internal stakeholders.

element.name: Financial Business Advice and Decision Support
element.documentation: Ability to fulfil the business partner role of Finance delivering proactive decision support (ranging from product pricing advice to a major divestment analysis), performance management and planning. This includes the ability to produce, explain, review and submit reports / data to internal stakeholders with respect to business results, trends and financial issue, as well as handling inquiries from internal stakeholders.

property.value: Ability to fulfil the business partner role of Finance delivering proactive decision support (ranging from product pricing advice to a major divestment analysis), performance management and planning. This includes the ability to produce, explain, review and submit reports / data to internal stakeholders with respect to business results, trends and financial issue, as well as handling inquiries from internal stakeholders.

element.name: Horizon Scanning
element.documentation: The ability to scan the various channels for concrete regulations and other developments impacting ING in applicable jurisdictions, and to maintain a view on these.

property.value: The ability to scan the various channels for concrete regulations and other developments impacting ING in applicable jurisdictions, and to maintain a view on these.

element.name: Data Lineage
element.documentation: Ability to provide insight into how data is captured in systems and is processed between systems, resulting in an end to end flow on meta data level in order to support information management, compliance (BCBS239) and audit (completeness of e.g. aggregated reports and models).

property.value: Ability to provide insight into how data is captured in systems and is processed between systems, resulting in an end to end flow on meta data level in order to support information management, compliance (BCBS239) and audit (completeness of e.g. aggregated reports and models).

element.name: Change Management
element.documentation: Ability to focus on the implementation of the change from a human perspective, involving all the stakeholders affected by a change, covering communication, assessments, process redesign, reorganization, worker mobility support

property.value: Ability to focus on the implementation of the change from a human perspective, involving all the stakeholders affected by a change, covering communication, assessments, process redesign, reorganization, worker mobility support

element.name: Financial advising business management
element.documentation: Ability to proactively provide business advice (regular and non regular) to management on financial issues for the Bank based on performance management outcomes, market trends and other financial and non financial information. Objective To make necessary judgements for management decisions and the handling of risks and to advice management on actions to be taken to ensure that strategic objectives will be attained.

property.value: Ability to proactively provide business advice (regular and non regular) to management on financial issues for the Bank based on performance management outcomes, market trends and other financial and non financial information. Objective To make necessary judgements for management decisions and the handling of risks and to advice management on actions to be taken to ensure that strategic objectives will be attained.

element.name: Dynamic Planning and Performance Management
element.documentation: Ability to ensure that ING?s strategic goals are consistently being met in an effective and efficient manner. It includes: - planning and target setting - development of Bank financial plan from strategic plan (Dynamic Plan) - planning, monitoring and validation of Business Unit financial plans - periodic performance measurement. Objective To ensure that ING?s strategic goals are consistently being met in an effective and efficient manner.

property.value: Ability to ensure that ING?s strategic goals are consistently being met in an effective and efficient manner. It includes: - planning and target setting - development of Bank financial plan from strategic plan (Dynamic Plan) - planning, monitoring and validation of Business Unit financial plans - periodic performance measurement. Objective To ensure that ING?s strategic goals are consistently being met in an effective and efficient manner.

element.name: Data Exchange
element.documentation: Ability to allow data that is recorded in one area to be distributed to another so that it can be used for purposes of enrichments, reporting and/or modelling.

property.value: Ability to allow data that is recorded in one area to be distributed to another so that it can be used for purposes of enrichments, reporting and/or modelling.

element.name: Capital charging
element.documentation: Ability to influence metrics by allocating additional costs to the deployment of capital if appropriate. Objective ING aims to optimally deploy capital throughout the organization. Given that capital is a scares resource it is especially important to have the right incentives in place. For capital management this will result in entities having a natural drive to optimize their capital stack and consequently will result in upstreaming excess capital which can then be used centrally or held centrally to optimize deployment of capital and for contingency purposes.

property.value: Ability to influence metrics by allocating additional costs to the deployment of capital if appropriate. Objective ING aims to optimally deploy capital throughout the organization. Given that capital is a scares resource it is especially important to have the right incentives in place. For capital management this will result in entities having a natural drive to optimize their capital stack and consequently will result in upstreaming excess capital which can then be used centrally or held centrally to optimize deployment of capital and for contingency purposes.

element.name: Explanation of financial facts for external stakeholders
element.documentation: Ability to interpret and to combine internal and external financial information to explain key business results, trends, issues etc. The result of this process provides the basis for value-added advice on Finance issues to business decision-makers. This sub capability delivers the textual input for reporting to external stakeholders and extends the analytical review performed as part of accounting. Objective Obtain a relevant and meaningful interpretation of financial facts, trends and developments.

property.value: Ability to interpret and to combine internal and external financial information to explain key business results, trends, issues etc. The result of this process provides the basis for value-added advice on Finance issues to business decision-makers. This sub capability delivers the textual input for reporting to external stakeholders and extends the analytical review performed as part of accounting. Objective Obtain a relevant and meaningful interpretation of financial facts, trends and developments.

element.name: Capital Management
element.documentation: Ability to ensure - funding needs are met over 1 year and longer, including secured and unsecured senior debt as well as capital issuances - capital adequacy supporting the Business activities of ING at all levels and according to multiple viewpoints; regulators, rating agencies and (internal) economic capital models.

property.value: Ability to ensure - funding needs are met over 1 year and longer, including secured and unsecured senior debt as well as capital issuances - capital adequacy supporting the Business activities of ING at all levels and according to multiple viewpoints; regulators, rating agencies and (internal) economic capital models.

element.name: Explanation of financial facts for internal stakeholders
element.documentation: Ability to interpret and to combine internal and external financial information to explain key business results, trends, issues etc. The result of this process provides the basis for value-added advice on Finance issues to business decision-makers. This sub capability delivers the textual input for reporting to internal stakeholders and extends the analytical review performed as part of accounting.

property.value: Ability to interpret and to combine internal and external financial information to explain key business results, trends, issues etc. The result of this process provides the basis for value-added advice on Finance issues to business decision-makers. This sub capability delivers the textual input for reporting to internal stakeholders and extends the analytical review performed as part of accounting.

element.name: SoR data enriching
element.documentation: Ability to enrich Business Objects data as part of the Inventory data with derived data. Objective To provide and capture all data (insights) necessary on the Business Object, on top of the foundational data set, to enable further classifications, computations and reporting views on the data. Example - Enrich the data with the Booking Center and Business Unit based on the Profit Center Code. - Enrich SoR-data with Market data or CounterParty data - SME (Small Medium Enterprise) determination

property.value: Ability to enrich Business Objects data as part of the Inventory data with derived data. Objective To provide and capture all data (insights) necessary on the Business Object, on top of the foundational data set, to enable further classifications, computations and reporting views on the data. Example - Enrich the data with the Booking Center and Business Unit based on the Profit Center Code. - Enrich SoR-data with Market data or CounterParty data - SME (Small Medium Enterprise) determination

element.name: Data Security and Protection
element.documentation: Ability to provide insight into how data is captured in systems and is processed between systems, resulting in an end to end flow on meta data level in order to support information management, compliance (BCBS239) and audit.

property.value: Ability to provide insight into how data is captured in systems and is processed between systems, resulting in an end to end flow on meta data level in order to support information management, compliance (BCBS239) and audit.

element.name: Strategy Research
element.documentation: Ability to investigate the markets and the implications of the trends of the society, identify the internal strengths of ING, identify the desired customers and arbitrate the strategic dilemmas

property.value: Ability to investigate the markets and the implications of the trends of the society, identify the internal strengths of ING, identify the desired customers and arbitrate the strategic dilemmas

element.name: Program Portfolio Management
element.documentation: Ability to structure, prioritize, recommend, govern and report on the investment in an overall portfolio, to implement the strategy

property.value: Ability to structure, prioritize, recommend, govern and report on the investment in an overall portfolio, to implement the strategy

element.name: Finance reporting to external stakeholders
element.documentation: Ability to produce, explain, review and submit statutory, regulatory, supervisory and any other reports to external stakeholders. This also includes handling inquiries from external stakeholders. Objective To inform external stakeholders, compliant with their requirements, about the financial position and performance of ING or elements thereof.

property.value: Ability to produce, explain, review and submit statutory, regulatory, supervisory and any other reports to external stakeholders. This also includes handling inquiries from external stakeholders. Objective To inform external stakeholders, compliant with their requirements, about the financial position and performance of ING or elements thereof.

element.name: Finance Reporting Foundation Management
element.documentation: Ability to prepare Accounting data and source data (from Systems of Record) for reporting. Objective Objective is to have source data and Accounting data in such a manner ordered, modelled, enriched, derived, aggregated, and calculated that it can be reported according the reporting requirements.

property.value: Ability to prepare Accounting data and source data (from Systems of Record) for reporting. Objective Objective is to have source data and Accounting data in such a manner ordered, modelled, enriched, derived, aggregated, and calculated that it can be reported according the reporting requirements.

element.name: Business Event enrichment into Financial Event
element.documentation: Ability to enrich Business Events with financial impact with additional characteristics in order to be able to translate these financial events into accounting events. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate, and timely recording of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements.

property.value: Ability to enrich Business Events with financial impact with additional characteristics in order to be able to translate these financial events into accounting events. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate, and timely recording of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements.

element.name: Asset and Liability Neting
element.documentation: Ability to offset assets and liabilities into one position. Example GAAP rules state that if you company deals in derivatives, and has a derivative asset and a derivative liability with the same party, you may be able to report these as a single balance-sheet entry, either as a net liability or a net asset.

property.value: Ability to offset assets and liabilities into one position. Example GAAP rules state that if you company deals in derivatives, and has a derivative asset and a derivative liability with the same party, you may be able to report these as a single balance-sheet entry, either as a net liability or a net asset.

element.name: Financials to business (SoR) objects matching
element.documentation: Ability to match & merge inventory data from SoRs with Risk data and Accounting data a.o. Objective To create a consistent foundational data set as starting point for reconciliation, analysis and reporting.

property.value: Ability to match & merge inventory data from SoRs with Risk data and Accounting data a.o. Objective To create a consistent foundational data set as starting point for reconciliation, analysis and reporting.

element.name: Operational sign-off on finance data
element.documentation: Ability to have responsible business management to confirm that Finance data recorded is correct and complete by singing off on the reported figures. Objective: Ensure reliability of financial data in systems

property.value: Ability to have responsible business management to confirm that Finance data recorded is correct and complete by singing off on the reported figures. Objective: Ensure reliability of financial data in systems

element.name: Account reporting
element.documentation: Ability to produce, explain, review and submit reports to internal and external stakeholders on the recording and processing of financial data, resulting in the permanent summary of classified financial positions (?bookkeeping of balances?) that capture the state of the enterprise at particular moments in time ( ?closing of the books?).

property.value: Ability to produce, explain, review and submit reports to internal and external stakeholders on the recording and processing of financial data, resulting in the permanent summary of classified financial positions (?bookkeeping of balances?) that capture the state of the enterprise at particular moments in time ( ?closing of the books?).

element.name: Cost Accounting
element.documentation: Ability to account for all variable and fixed costs associated not directly related to the creation of the products / services of the organisation. Objective: Cost accounting is used internally by management in order to make fully informed business decisions. However, cost accounting does need to take into account external regulations (Financial Accounting) where applicable (e.g. inter-entity cost allocations, incl. V.A.T.) Cost accounting considers all input costs associated not directly related to production, including both variable and fixed costs. Types of cost accounting include standard costing, activity-based costing, lean accounting, and marginal costing.

property.value: Ability to account for all variable and fixed costs associated not directly related to the creation of the products / services of the organisation. Objective: Cost accounting is used internally by management in order to make fully informed business decisions. However, cost accounting does need to take into account external regulations (Financial Accounting) where applicable (e.g. inter-entity cost allocations, incl. V.A.T.) Cost accounting considers all input costs associated not directly related to production, including both variable and fixed costs. Types of cost accounting include standard costing, activity-based costing, lean accounting, and marginal costing.

element.name: FX translating
element.documentation: Ability to translate balances in different currencies to a reporting currency of the entire consolidated entity.

property.value: Ability to translate balances in different currencies to a reporting currency of the entire consolidated entity.

element.name: Business Events with financial impact selecting
element.documentation: Ability to identify and select from all ING Business Events those Business Events with a financial impact; either resulting in a cash flow, a profit, loss, or an (contingent) asset or a liability. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate, and timely) recording of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements .

property.value: Ability to identify and select from all ING Business Events those Business Events with a financial impact; either resulting in a cash flow, a profit, loss, or an (contingent) asset or a liability. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate, and timely) recording of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements .

element.name: Product Accounting
element.documentation: Ability to account in detail for banking products. Additional description This process provides full subledger capabilities for financial instruments with parallel valuation in accordance with different national and international accounting standards. Standard methods for the valuation of financial positions are available that take into account fair value (unrealized profit/loss), amortized cost, accrual of interest and fees, deferral, strict and moderate lower of cost or market, foreign currency, and hedge adjustment. External pricing tools can be integrated for the valuation of special financial instruments (for example, exotic options.

property.value: Ability to account in detail for banking products. Additional description This process provides full subledger capabilities for financial instruments with parallel valuation in accordance with different national and international accounting standards. Standard methods for the valuation of financial positions are available that take into account fair value (unrealized profit/loss), amortized cost, accrual of interest and fees, deferral, strict and moderate lower of cost or market, foreign currency, and hedge adjustment. External pricing tools can be integrated for the valuation of special financial instruments (for example, exotic options.

element.name: Inter Company Accounting
element.documentation: Ability to account for financial transactions between different entities within the same parent company. Objective: Because these entities are related, the transactions between them are not ?independent? and companies can?t include a profit or loss from these transactions on consolidated financial statements. Therefore, if these kinds of transactions are not correctly accounted for and later on eliminated correctly, any out-of-balance accounts can seriously impact financial statements, creating compliance issues, the risk of restatement, SEC imposed fines, and shareholder lawsuits.

property.value: Ability to account for financial transactions between different entities within the same parent company. Objective: Because these entities are related, the transactions between them are not ?independent? and companies can?t include a profit or loss from these transactions on consolidated financial statements. Therefore, if these kinds of transactions are not correctly accounted for and later on eliminated correctly, any out-of-balance accounts can seriously impact financial statements, creating compliance issues, the risk of restatement, SEC imposed fines, and shareholder lawsuits.

element.name: Balance sheet dynamic planning and monitoring
element.documentation: Ability to plan, report, analyse, monitor & provide explanations on the development of the Balance Sheet versus Dynamic Planning.

property.value: Ability to plan, report, analyse, monitor & provide explanations on the development of the Balance Sheet versus Dynamic Planning.

element.name: Financial Closing
element.documentation: Ability to prepare accounts for financial statement preparation by the end of the period and the start of the next accounting period. Objective The closing process consists of steps to revalue, allocate and transfer temporary account balances to permanent accounts and make the general ledger ready for the next accounting period.

property.value: Ability to prepare accounts for financial statement preparation by the end of the period and the start of the next accounting period. Objective The closing process consists of steps to revalue, allocate and transfer temporary account balances to permanent accounts and make the general ledger ready for the next accounting period.

element.name: Project and Program Accounting
element.documentation: Ability to account for all activities undertaken in change initiatives, covering financial and non-financial impact from investments (and out of pocket expenses) both on the cost and on the benefit side.

property.value: Ability to account for all activities undertaken in change initiatives, covering financial and non-financial impact from investments (and out of pocket expenses) both on the cost and on the benefit side.

element.name: Financial elimination
element.documentation: Ability to fully eliminate balances and transactions, including all revenues, expense and balance sheet items between internal counterparts. Objective To get reliable, aggregated figures which comply with group and local Financial standards and stakeholder requirements.

property.value: Ability to fully eliminate balances and transactions, including all revenues, expense and balance sheet items between internal counterparts. Objective To get reliable, aggregated figures which comply with group and local Financial standards and stakeholder requirements.

element.name: Account reconciliation
element.documentation: Ability to reconcile different data sets (which are subject to data transport, data transformation and data storing) with each other, to ensure that data transformation and transport is controlled (complete and correct) . Objective: To verify the quality of data as it flows through processes and to detect irregularities through data handling.

property.value: Ability to reconcile different data sets (which are subject to data transport, data transformation and data storing) with each other, to ensure that data transformation and transport is controlled (complete and correct) . Objective: To verify the quality of data as it flows through processes and to detect irregularities through data handling.

element.name: Source - target reconciliation
element.documentation: Ability to reconcile accounting balances with a source file. Objective To ensure reliable source data as bases for Finance & Risk reporting.

property.value: Ability to reconcile accounting balances with a source file. Objective To ensure reliable source data as bases for Finance & Risk reporting.

element.name: Tax planning and advice
element.documentation: Ability to assist management in meeting tax obligations imposed by laws and regulations, to manage risks related to these obligations and optimising after tax result. To exert oversight and control on above activities and to ensure that the financial consequences of ING?s tax obligations are adequately reflected in ING?s financial statements. Objective To meet tax obligations, manage related risks and optimise after tax result.

property.value: Ability to assist management in meeting tax obligations imposed by laws and regulations, to manage risks related to these obligations and optimising after tax result. To exert oversight and control on above activities and to ensure that the financial consequences of ING?s tax obligations are adequately reflected in ING?s financial statements. Objective To meet tax obligations, manage related risks and optimise after tax result.

element.name: Accounts Receivable
element.documentation: Ability to account for the money due to ING for goods or services delivered or used but not yet paid for by customers. Objective : Accounts receivable is an asset account on the balance sheet that represents money due to a company in the short-term. Accounts receivables are created when a company lets a buyer purchase their goods or services on credit. Accounts payable is similar to accounts receivable, but instead of money to be received, it?s money owed. The strength of a company?s AR can be analyzed with the accounts receivable turnover ratio or days sales outstanding. A turnover ratio analysis can be completed to have an expectation when the AR will actually be received.

property.value: Ability to account for the money due to ING for goods or services delivered or used but not yet paid for by customers. Objective : Accounts receivable is an asset account on the balance sheet that represents money due to a company in the short-term. Accounts receivables are created when a company lets a buyer purchase their goods or services on credit. Accounts payable is similar to accounts receivable, but instead of money to be received, it?s money owed. The strength of a company?s AR can be analyzed with the accounts receivable turnover ratio or days sales outstanding. A turnover ratio analysis can be completed to have an expectation when the AR will actually be received.

element.name: Financial Events translation into accounting events
element.documentation: Ability to translate Financial Events using accounting rules into specific accounting events; resulting in journals posted to a specific (sub-)ledger. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate, and timely) recording of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements.

property.value: Ability to translate Financial Events using accounting rules into specific accounting events; resulting in journals posted to a specific (sub-)ledger. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate, and timely) recording of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements.

element.name: Suspense account reporting
element.documentation: Ability to report on the handling of suspense accounts, which temporarily or permanently carry doubtful entries and discrepancies pending their analysis and permanent classification. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate, and timely) recording and processing of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements.

property.value: Ability to report on the handling of suspense accounts, which temporarily or permanently carry doubtful entries and discrepancies pending their analysis and permanent classification. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate, and timely) recording and processing of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements.

element.name: Aging reporting
element.documentation: Ability to categorise the balances according to the duration of the amount of the account. Objective To determine the financial health of the customers. If the accounts receivable show receivables are being collected at much slower rate than normal this is a warning sigh that business may be slowing down or that the company is taking greater credit risk in its sales practices.

property.value: Ability to categorise the balances according to the duration of the amount of the account. Objective To determine the financial health of the customers. If the accounts receivable show receivables are being collected at much slower rate than normal this is a warning sigh that business may be slowing down or that the company is taking greater credit risk in its sales practices.

element.name: Ledger closing
element.documentation: Ability to close the books of the previous period and open the general ledger for the next accounting period.

property.value: Ability to close the books of the previous period and open the general ledger for the next accounting period.

element.name: Error reporting
element.documentation: Ability to list any errors in the accounting process. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate, and timely) recording and processing of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements.

property.value: Ability to list any errors in the accounting process. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate, and timely) recording and processing of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements.

element.name: Manage corrections and adjustments
element.documentation: Ability to enter and approve accounting entries in order to solve identified differences and errors and/or to add non-automated accounting entries. Objective: Correction of error and/or enrichment of data

property.value: Ability to enter and approve accounting entries in order to solve identified differences and errors and/or to add non-automated accounting entries. Objective: Correction of error and/or enrichment of data

element.name: Manual entries reporitng
element.documentation: Ability to list any journal which was entered manually. Objective To control accuracy and correctness of manual entries after the fact, enabling validation with the business transaction and underlying source documentation.

property.value: Ability to list any journal which was entered manually. Objective To control accuracy and correctness of manual entries after the fact, enabling validation with the business transaction and underlying source documentation.

element.name: Finance Analytical review
element.documentation: Analytical review is consistently performed in accordance with documented procedure, containing: - what data and reports are used in the control; - the systems that information is generated from; - how the reviewer knows that information is accurate and complete; - the criteria used by the reviewer to identify matters for investigation, incl. how the reviewer develops expectations, level of precision and the level of aggregation of the data used; and - how items identified for investigation are resolved (follow-up). Control Objective Material misstatements are timely detected and corrected. Source definition - Finance and Regulatory Reporting Minimum Standard (F&RR MM) - Study: "Analytical Review requirements, and those of related processes", 19 September 2019.

property.value: Analytical review is consistently performed in accordance with documented procedure, containing: - what data and reports are used in the control; - the systems that information is generated from; - how the reviewer knows that information is accurate and complete; - the criteria used by the reviewer to identify matters for investigation, incl. how the reviewer develops expectations, level of precision and the level of aggregation of the data used; and - how items identified for investigation are resolved (follow-up). Control Objective Material misstatements are timely detected and corrected. Source definition - Finance and Regulatory Reporting Minimum Standard (F&RR MM) - Study: "Analytical Review requirements, and those of related processes", 19 September 2019.

element.name: Allocation
element.documentation: Ability to allocate costs to objects, using a rational basis of allotment.

property.value: Ability to allocate costs to objects, using a rational basis of allotment.

element.name: Revaluation
element.documentation: Ability to adjust the recorded value of an asset to accurately reflect its current fair value. (If FX revaluation is meant here: the ability to revalue foreign exchange rate denominated balances into the base currency of the entity leading to a foreign exchange difference result).

property.value: Ability to adjust the recorded value of an asset to accurately reflect its current fair value. (If FX revaluation is meant here: the ability to revalue foreign exchange rate denominated balances into the base currency of the entity leading to a foreign exchange difference result).

element.name: Account substantiation
element.documentation: Ability to confirm that the balances held in the ledger are reconciled (in balance with) with the balance and transaction records held in the same or supporting sub-systems and therefore are correct and complete.

property.value: Ability to confirm that the balances held in the ledger are reconciled (in balance with) with the balance and transaction records held in the same or supporting sub-systems and therefore are correct and complete.

element.name: Finance internal balance sheet and profit & loss reporting
element.documentation: Ability to report, analyse, monitor & provide explanations on the Balance Sheet and Profit & Loss. Objective To provide Business management insight about the financial position and performance of the Bank or elements thereof, in order to support business decisions.

property.value: Ability to report, analyse, monitor & provide explanations on the Balance Sheet and Profit & Loss. Objective To provide Business management insight about the financial position and performance of the Bank or elements thereof, in order to support business decisions.

element.name: Fixed Asset Accounting
element.documentation: Ability account in detail for ING's non-current assets that are used in its business operations. Objective: ING's fixed assets are reported in the noncurrent (or long-term) asset section of the balance sheet in the section described as property, plant and equipment. The fixed assets except for land will be depreciated and their accumulated depreciation will also be reported under property, plant and equipment.

property.value: Ability account in detail for ING's non-current assets that are used in its business operations. Objective: ING's fixed assets are reported in the noncurrent (or long-term) asset section of the balance sheet in the section described as property, plant and equipment. The fixed assets except for land will be depreciated and their accumulated depreciation will also be reported under property, plant and equipment.

element.name: Inverse cumulative gap reporting
element.documentation: Ability to independently monitor actual and forecasted Profit & Loss by determining the embedded future accural income profile for Treasury books and split per originating Basis, Liquidity and Interest position under run off and assumption. Although Treasury/Finance creates this report in service of the Treasury Front Office, this report is also the basis for the Rolling Forecast and Dynamic Planning.

property.value: Ability to independently monitor actual and forecasted Profit & Loss by determining the embedded future accural income profile for Treasury books and split per originating Basis, Liquidity and Interest position under run off and assumption. Although Treasury/Finance creates this report in service of the Treasury Front Office, this report is also the basis for the Rolling Forecast and Dynamic Planning.

element.name: Accounts Payable
element.documentation: Ability to account for the obligation to pay off a short-term debt to ING's creditors or suppliers. Objective: Accounts payable are amounts due to vendors or suppliers for goods or services received that have not yet been paid for. The sum of all outstanding amounts owed to vendors is shown as the accounts payable balance on the company's balance sheet. The increase or decrease in total AP from the prior period appears on the cash flow statement. Management may choose to pay its outstanding bills as close to their due dates as possible in order to improve cash flow.

property.value: Ability to account for the obligation to pay off a short-term debt to ING's creditors or suppliers. Objective: Accounts payable are amounts due to vendors or suppliers for goods or services received that have not yet been paid for. The sum of all outstanding amounts owed to vendors is shown as the accounts payable balance on the company's balance sheet. The increase or decrease in total AP from the prior period appears on the cash flow statement. Management may choose to pay its outstanding bills as close to their due dates as possible in order to improve cash flow.

element.name: Financial classification of Business (Systems of Record) objects
element.documentation: Ability to classify Business Objects (Involved Party data, Agreement data, Product Data, Protection data) according reporting requirements. Objective To classify Business Objects in accordance with reporting requirements, in order to be able to select, structure, or aggregate the objects in question as preparation for certain calculations and / or views on the data. Example - EBA FINREP CounterParty classification - Financial Instrument classification for AnaCredit

property.value: Ability to classify Business Objects (Involved Party data, Agreement data, Product Data, Protection data) according reporting requirements. Objective To classify Business Objects in accordance with reporting requirements, in order to be able to select, structure, or aggregate the objects in question as preparation for certain calculations and / or views on the data. Example - EBA FINREP CounterParty classification - Financial Instrument classification for AnaCredit

element.name: Rolling forecast versus dynamic planning monitoring
element.documentation: Ability to plan, report, analyse, monitor & provide explanations on developments on the Rolling Forecast versus the Dynamic Plan.

property.value: Ability to plan, report, analyse, monitor & provide explanations on developments on the Rolling Forecast versus the Dynamic Plan.

element.name: Technical finance analytical review
element.documentation: Ability to analyse significant ratios and trends including the resulting investigation of fluctuations and relationships that are inconsistent with other relevant information or deviate from predicted amounts. Objective The technical analytical review allows Finance to identify balances and movements over time that are not in line with the expectations and is also an important plausibility check for COO Finance to reveal book/processing errors that require remediation. Example Financial Reporting Fluctuation (?Flux?) Analysis - Flux analysis involves aggregating data from multiple periods and identifying material fluctuations from period to period, and what caused them.

property.value: Ability to analyse significant ratios and trends including the resulting investigation of fluctuations and relationships that are inconsistent with other relevant information or deviate from predicted amounts. Objective The technical analytical review allows Finance to identify balances and movements over time that are not in line with the expectations and is also an important plausibility check for COO Finance to reveal book/processing errors that require remediation. Example Financial Reporting Fluctuation (?Flux?) Analysis - Flux analysis involves aggregating data from multiple periods and identifying material fluctuations from period to period, and what caused them.

element.name: Trial Balance reporting
element.documentation: Ability to list all accounts in the general ledger along with each account's balance in the appropriate debit or credit column. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate, and timely) recording and processing of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements.

property.value: Ability to list all accounts in the general ledger along with each account's balance in the appropriate debit or credit column. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate, and timely) recording and processing of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements.

element.name: Consoilidation corrections
element.documentation: Ability to recognize accounting differences to prepare for the consolidation and reporting.

property.value: Ability to recognize accounting differences to prepare for the consolidation and reporting.

element.name: Reconciliation reporting
element.documentation: Ability to list any differences between compared related accounted balances and a source fille. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate, and timely) recording and processing of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements.

property.value: Ability to list any differences between compared related accounted balances and a source fille. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate, and timely) recording and processing of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements.

element.name: Inter company matching
element.documentation: Ability to check the equivalence between related inter company balances and/or internal deals. This capability includes the creation of a matching report. Objective To ensure the balance between related internal accounts and deals.

property.value: Ability to check the equivalence between related inter company balances and/or internal deals. This capability includes the creation of a matching report. Objective To ensure the balance between related internal accounts and deals.

element.name: Funding & Liquidity dynamic planning and montioring
element.documentation: Ability to coordinate the: coordinate the incorporation of the Funding & Liquidity risk appetite and related limits in the Dynamic plan. coordinate the alignment of the ING Bank funding plan with the Dynamic plan. monitor the actual realisation of Funding and Liquidity management by 1st line, in consultation with the Asset and Liability Management Risk function.

property.value: Ability to coordinate the: coordinate the incorporation of the Funding & Liquidity risk appetite and related limits in the Dynamic plan. coordinate the alignment of the ING Bank funding plan with the Dynamic plan. monitor the actual realisation of Funding and Liquidity management by 1st line, in consultation with the Asset and Liability Management Risk function.

element.name: Explaining source - target reconciliation differences
element.documentation: Ability to explain non-matching open items resulting from source/target reconciliation. This could lead to corrections of accounting entries. Objective To ensure quality of data.

property.value: Ability to explain non-matching open items resulting from source/target reconciliation. This could lead to corrections of accounting entries. Objective To ensure quality of data.

element.name: Equalization
element.documentation: Ability to recognize an entity's profit or loss in its parent company's financial statement, as a correction to investment in the entity and it's own profit-and-loss and equity income. Objective When a subsidiary's equity changes during the year, its parents will want to update their books to reflect those changes. This is important because it gives an accurate depiction of those parent statements on a standalone basis if these companies are reporting separately to regulatory agencies. When the organization as a whole presents its consolidated financial statements, this change in value requires elimination. The only impact that equitization should have on the consolidated reports is to show the portion of the subsidiary's change in equity for the current period or year that belongs to outside owners (non-controlling interest), if applicable.

property.value: Ability to recognize an entity's profit or loss in its parent company's financial statement, as a correction to investment in the entity and it's own profit-and-loss and equity income. Objective When a subsidiary's equity changes during the year, its parents will want to update their books to reflect those changes. This is important because it gives an accurate depiction of those parent statements on a standalone basis if these companies are reporting separately to regulatory agencies. When the organization as a whole presents its consolidated financial statements, this change in value requires elimination. The only impact that equitization should have on the consolidated reports is to show the portion of the subsidiary's change in equity for the current period or year that belongs to outside owners (non-controlling interest), if applicable.

element.name: Cost management
element.documentation: Ability to monitor, explain and manage cost recharges.

property.value: Ability to monitor, explain and manage cost recharges.

element.name: Hedge Accounting
element.documentation: Ability to match the accounting treatment of the hedged item with the hedge instrument in the profit and loss account. Objective: ING use derivative financial instruments to hedge its exposure to different risks (for example interest rate risk, foreign exchange risk, commodity risk, etc.).Accounting for derivative financial instruments under International Accounting Standards is covered by IAS39 (Financial Instrument: Recognition and Measurement). IAS39 requires that all derivatives are marked-to-market with changes in the mark-to-market being taken to the profit and loss account. For many entities this would result in a significant amount of profit and loss volatility arising from the use of derivatives. Hedge accounting attempts to reduce the volatility created by the repeated adjustment to a financial instrument's value, known as fair value accounting or mark to market. This reduced volatility is done by combining the instrument and the hedge as one entry, which offsets the opposing's movements.

property.value: Ability to match the accounting treatment of the hedged item with the hedge instrument in the profit and loss account. Objective: ING use derivative financial instruments to hedge its exposure to different risks (for example interest rate risk, foreign exchange risk, commodity risk, etc.).Accounting for derivative financial instruments under International Accounting Standards is covered by IAS39 (Financial Instrument: Recognition and Measurement). IAS39 requires that all derivatives are marked-to-market with changes in the mark-to-market being taken to the profit and loss account. For many entities this would result in a significant amount of profit and loss volatility arising from the use of derivatives.
