Hedge accounting attempts to reduce the volatility created by the repeated adjustment to a financial instrument's value, known as fair value accounting or mark to market. This reduced volatility is done by combining the instrument and the hedge as one entry, which offsets the opposing's movements.

element.name: Detailed Accounting
element.documentation: The ability to account the detailed financial events pertaining a specific business object in a sub ledger at a granular level, which is needed to perform controls and to enable reporting at a detailed level. Objective: Provided detailed balanced information on a certain aspect of the business; being an asset, product, customer, creditor, or certain costs. The total of the transactions in the subledger aggregate (Financial aggregation) into the general ledger. (The results of subledger postings are aggregated to the granularity level of the general ledger). As part of the year-end audit procedures, auditors may trace transactions from a subledger to the general ledger and from there to the financial statements, to ensure that transactions are being recorded properly in the accounting system.

property.value: The ability to account the detailed financial events pertaining a specific business object in a sub ledger at a granular level, which is needed to perform controls and to enable reporting at a detailed level. Objective: Provided detailed balanced information on a certain aspect of the business; being an asset, product, customer, creditor, or certain costs. The total of the transactions in the subledger aggregate (Financial aggregation) into the general ledger. (The results of subledger postings are aggregated to the granularity level of the general ledger). As part of the year-end audit procedures, auditors may trace transactions from a subledger to the general ledger and from there to the financial statements, to ensure that transactions are being recorded properly in the accounting system.

element.name: Intracomptabel Netting
element.documentation: Ability to offset the value of multiple positions, liabilities or payments or obligations due to be exchanged between two or more parties. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate, and timely) recording of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements. With large volumes netting can be applied to increase efficiency and reduce costs, or for regulatory reasons.

property.value: Ability to offset the value of multiple positions, liabilities or payments or obligations due to be exchanged between two or more parties. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate, and timely) recording of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements. With large volumes netting can be applied to increase efficiency and reduce costs, or for regulatory reasons.

element.name: Business analytical review
element.documentation: Ability to explain statutory and regulatory reports in relation to economical and business reasons (Business analytical review) and be able to use control evidence provided by the service center (technical analytical review) for this task. See also ?Analytical review? Source Study: "Analytical Review requirements, and those of related processes", 19 September 2019.

property.value: Ability to explain statutory and regulatory reports in relation to economical and business reasons (Business analytical review) and be able to use control evidence provided by the service center (technical analytical review) for this task. See also ?Analytical review? Source Study: "Analytical Review requirements, and those of related processes", 19 September 2019.

element.name: Financial aggregation
element.documentation: Ability to prepare consolidated figures, combining relevant figures on a line-by-line basis by adding together like items. Objective To get reliable, aggregated figures at consolidated level which comply with group and local Financial standards and (internal) stakeholder requirements.

property.value: Ability to prepare consolidated figures, combining relevant figures on a line-by-line basis by adding together like items. Objective To get reliable, aggregated figures at consolidated level which comply with group and local Financial standards and (internal) stakeholder requirements.

element.name: Account controlling
element.documentation: Ability to control, monitor and evaluate accounting activities and reports in compliance with Finance policies and procedures to ensure completeness and correctness.

property.value: Ability to control, monitor and evaluate accounting activities and reports in compliance with Finance policies and procedures to ensure completeness and correctness.

element.name: Financial Data Point determination
element.documentation: Ability to determine and compute a Data Point on a prescribed reporting template, in accordance with the required data dimensions such as time, organisation, accounting (GAAP), product, counterparty, risk, and currency. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate and timely) recording and processing of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements. Such a reporting template could be prescribed because of staturory, regulatory, management or other (internal) reporting purposes. Examples: - EBA Data Point Model - ING Annual Accounts according IFRS

property.value: Ability to determine and compute a Data Point on a prescribed reporting template, in accordance with the required data dimensions such as time, organisation, accounting (GAAP), product, counterparty, risk, and currency. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate and timely) recording and processing of financial data which comply with internal and external requirements. Such a reporting template could be prescribed because of staturory, regulatory, management or other (internal) reporting purposes. Examples: - EBA Data Point Model - ING Annual Accounts according IFRS

element.name: Intercompany matching reporing
element.documentation: Ability to report on the match result of intercompany transactions on applicable dimensions. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate, and timely) recording and processing of financial data which comply with internal and external requirement s.

property.value: Ability to report on the match result of intercompany transactions on applicable dimensions. Objective To ensure reliable (complete, accurate, and timely) recording and processing of financial data which comply with internal and external requirement s.

element.name: Finance Business Analytical Review
element.documentation: Ability to explain finance statutory and regulatory reports in relation to economical and business reasons (Business analytical review) and be able to use control evidence provided by the service center (technical analytical review) for this task. See also ?Analytical review? Source Study: "Analytical Review requirements, and those of related processes", 19 September 2019.

property.value: Ability to explain finance statutory and regulatory reports in relation to economical and business reasons (Business analytical review) and be able to use control evidence provided by the service center (technical analytical review) for this task. See also ?Analytical review? Source Study: "Analytical Review requirements, and those of related processes", 19 September 2019.

view.name: Level 3 Capabilities - Finance Management
view.documentation: Ability to monitor and evaluate the operating effectiveness of the internal control framework to make sure that the controls with respect to the primary registration and subsequent financial reporting are effective. This also includes the implementation of internal controls and all actions inducing the execution of controls. Objective Ensuring operating effectiveness of Policies and Procedures.

node.label: Ability to manage and organise the Finance chain by developing and maintaining Finance governance and ensuring ongoing awareness. Objective: To have clear: organisation (structures), accountabilities and responsibilities within the Finance chain. demarcations with the Business and support functions, such as Risk and IT.

Strategy planning includes "Finance strategy planning" ? Ability to define the long term strategy and plan for Finance supporting the Bank in achieving its goals (vision) and the roadmap to realise targets set. Key activities include: - development of Finance strategy based on vision, mission and strategic goals - determination of KPIs to communicate and monitor achievement of goals within Finance - working with the Business to develop and align the plans to enable achieving financial objectives - revise plans and objectives to ensure that overall goals are met .

Ability to manage relationships with internal and external stakeholders to which Finance supplies its services, to support the organisation in achieving its strategic objectives and influence internal and external environments. Objective: To help ING achieve its strategic objectives by maintaining constructive relations with stakeholders
Ability to translate policies, guidelines and requirements into an operational planning, communication and monitoring of the operational planning. Objective: To ensure a timely process.
Data receiving and translation {Part of Data gathering}

Ability to receive Financial events, contracts, transactions, and other Finance relevant data. This data is translated into accounting entries using predefined rules. This includes receiving data from Business into Finance, and from Finance into Finance. Accounting logic includes currency conversions. Objective: To ensure a timely process.
Ability to have responsible management confirming that the Finance data recorded is correct and complete by signing off on the data. Objective: To ensure a correct data processing.
